localProof.directions: We are conveniently located at 1607 W University Drive, right near the University of North Texas campus and just a short drive from the historic Denton Square. If you are taking I-35E, use Exit 469 toward Downtown Denton for easy access.

stateCompliance.headline: Understanding Payday Loan Laws in Denton, Texas
stateCompliance.content: Denton residents are protected by both Texas state lending regulations and a local city ordinance that provides additional consumer protections. Texas allows payday loans through licensed Credit Access Businesses (CABs), and Ace Payday Loans is fully licensed and compliant with all state and local requirements.
stateCompliance.localOrdinanceNote: Denton has enacted a local payday lending ordinance that provides additional consumer protections. Under this ordinance, payday loans are limited to 20% of your gross monthly income, and rollovers are limited to 3 with a 25% principal reduction each time. This helps prevent the cycle of debt that can occur with unlimited rollovers.
keyPoints: Texas allows payday loans through licensed Credit Access Businesses (CABs) regulated by the OCCC
Denton has a local ordinance limiting payday loans to 20% of gross monthly income
Maximum 3 rollovers allowed with 25% principal reduction each time (city ordinance)
You have the right to cancel your loan within 3 days of signing without penalty
Lenders cannot threaten criminal prosecution for non-payment (except for fraud)
Your wages cannot be garnished for payday loan debt under Texas law
Always verify your lender is licensed at occc.texas.gov before borrowing
stateCompliance.regulatoryBody: Texas Office of Consumer Credit Commissioner (OCCC)

warningBox.title: Important Cost Warning
warningBox.content: Payday loans in Texas are among the most expensive in the nation. A typical $300 loan can cost over $1,000 in fees alone, resulting in APRs exceeding 700%. Consider alternatives such as credit union loans, payment plans with creditors, or nonprofit credit counseling before taking out a payday loan.

stateCompliance.disclaimer: This information is provided for general educational purposes only and should not be construed as legal advice. Payday loan laws and regulations change frequently. For the most accurate and up-to-date information, contact the Texas OCCC at (800) 538-1579 or visit occc.texas.gov. If you need legal advice, please consult with a licensed attorney in Texas.

reviews.name: Ashley K.
reviews.text: As a grad student at UNT, I needed help covering an unexpected expense. The Denton location was close to campus and the staff was understanding and professional. Quick approval too.

reviews.name: Marcus W.
reviews.text: Great location on University Drive. They explained the Denton city rules about loan limits which actually helped me not borrow more than I could afford. Honest and transparent.

reviews.name: Jennifer L.
reviews.text: Convenient location near the square. Process was faster than I expected. They were clear about all the fees before I signed anything.

nearbyLocations.headline: Also Serving Nearby Cities
nearbyLocations.intro: Cannot make it to our Denton location? We also serve:

faq.question: Where is your Denton location?
faq.answer: Our Denton branch is located at 1607 W University Drive, Suite 110, near the UNT campus. Take I-35E Exit 469 toward Downtown Denton for the quickest route.

faq.question: What are your hours in Denton?
faq.answer: We are open Monday through Friday 9 AM to 7 PM, and Saturday 10 AM to 4 PM. We are closed on Sundays.

faq.question: Does Denton have special payday loan rules?
faq.answer: Yes, Denton has a local ordinance that limits payday loans to 20% of your gross monthly income and restricts rollovers to a maximum of 3 with 25% principal reduction each time. This provides extra protection for Denton borrowers.

faq.question: Do I need an appointment at the Denton branch?
faq.answer: No appointment needed. Walk-ins are welcome during business hours. You can also apply online first to speed up the in-store process.

faq.question: What do I need to bring to the Denton location?
faq.answer: Bring a valid government ID, proof of income (pay stub or bank statement), and an active checking account. For title loans, also bring your vehicle and clear title.
